results.title: Western wheat
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Spencer and Larry Gosnell
results.brief_description: This film shows the drama of the wheat harvest played out on millions of western Canadian acres. In late summer great combine harvesters surge into the golden fields, and so begins the flow of a river of grain—from combine to truck, to prairie elevator, to grain cars, to marshalling yards and, finally, to Great Lakes terminal elevators and freighters. Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Michael Spencer and Larry Gosnell

results.title: Western waterways
results.brief_description: From its source in the Cotswold Hills, the Bristol Avon River winds its way through quiet pastoral country, presently reaching the city of Bath, famous for its period architecture and its mineral springs. The Avon flows through the industrial city of Bristol, one of the busiest ports of Britain, and near the sea at Avonmouth, the dockyards line the river banks.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling, Troy Maguire, Katherine O'Neill, Charles Skoutariotis, Dean Sacco, Chris Villarroel, Laura O'Donnell, Samantha Sharp, Marten McEachran, Krystal Webb, Ayen Guinto, Maria Savarino and Paul Young
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.

results.title: Western Samoa: the best of both worlds?
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Henrietta Clark
results.brief_description: Explores the changes occuring in Western Samoa which give young people the choice between the “modern” world of the capital city, Alpia and traditional village life. Explains how each family member has a particular role to perform within the structured village society.

results.title: Western Germany: the land and the people
results.brief_description: The industrial, agricultural and commercial life of Western Germany is shown in relationship to the dense population, natural resources, and relatively infertile soil of this area. The importance of coal, trade, and synthetic products in the industrial development of this country is shown against the background of its present-day economy.

results.title: Western Europe: an introduction
results.brief_description: An introduction to the basic geographic concepts of eleven countries in west Europe: Britain, Belgium, the Netherlands, Western Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France, Spain and Portugal. Presents the complexity of various countries and peoples; the dense population, the careful and varied uses of the land in relationship to the climate; the importance of manufacture and trade and also the close link between the history and geography of Europe to the western world.

results.title: Western Australia: the search for oil
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman A. Uren
results.brief_description: Shows the first operational stage of the search for oil at Exmouth Gulf (WA) including the seismograph party making exploratory drillings and echo soundings with explosives. (Explains the principle of this method with diagrams.) A highlight is the building of the large derrick before drilling for oil began.

results.title: Western Australia's moving memories...
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, Paul D. Barron and Glenda Hambly
results.brief_description: Picnic parties, picture shows and promenading. Festivities, fashions and frontiers. Living in the first half of this century in Western Australia had an elegance even in the hardships of its isolation and pioneer lifestyle. Watch Perth grow into a capital city and centre of commerce. Its streets and suburbs flourishing around the Swan River. Travel to rural centres where the whole community gathers to watch a race and to its frontier towns where gold is the currency of life and death. See everyday life as sheep are dipped, cattle are paraded at the Agricultural Show, and people picnic at the zoo, frolic on the beaches and run errands down the street. Made up of rare archival footage from Western Australian sources and from the National Film and Sound Archive this fascinating video includes newsreels, documentaries, and actuality footage from 1902 to 1952.
